overview: - Study•ies (n.)  From c. 1300 as "a state of deep thought or contemplation, of the not-yet-so-opaque, mental perplexity or anxious thought, amazement, wonder or reverie"  - Lunar (adj.)  from Latin lunaris "of the moon," Luna "moon"  from the greek word "Lùnca" same root of Lux and leuk, a proto-Indo-European root meaning "light, brightness."
title: Lunar Studies
